ProjectTitle: Solid catalysts for Functional group Shuttling
InitialFeedbackHistory: 06/08/2024 [REDACTED] [REDACTED] you use samples or materials? Please note that these are considered physical data in the context of a DMP, also list these the table and describe how you document, store and preserve them. [REDACTED] it is likely that your instruments generate metadata with the measurements, for more information see: www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/documentation-metadata [REDACTED] Please note that preserving data on external hard drives is not very secure, please have a look at the storage guide: https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en or contact your local IT department for alternatives. [REDACTED] Please explain under factors restricting sharing why you share under restricted access and not open, is this related to the valorization potential? [REDACTED] note that RDR will assign a DOI and that you need a sharing agreement instead of a licence for restricted data. https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr. [REDACTED] cost of sharing question refers to the use of the repositories which is free for RDR, for sharing during the project https://filesender.belnet.be/ is a more secure alternative to wetransfer.
